intro: Curculigo ensifolia var. albopilosa, commonly known as the white-haired arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its distinctive white, hairy stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its rhizomes are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
